main event: A civilian reported an unidentified aerial phenomenon over Guadaloupe Island on 6/11/53. The object was observed for 5 minutes, appeared to be stationary, and was described as an elongated, cigar-shaped object resembling a missile.
interesting points: The sighting was ground-visual with a length of observation of 5 minutes.
The witness reported seeing a blurry silhouette of an elongated, cigar-shaped object resembling a missile.
The witness indicated that the object was very bright white and longish, similar to a cigar in shape.
There were no photographs available, but there was a hand-drawn sketch of the object included in the report.
The witness indicated that the object seemed to hover, and the sighting was reported to an official after being encouraged by a co-pilot at Pan American.
sighted object: Elongated, cigar-shaped object resembling a missile
